availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Smoloff Palace Love (Muhlenberg County, teacher, merchant, attorney; lt col & col 11th KY)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, teacher, merchant, soldier, and attorney. Lincoln County, Kentucky, native. Married Jane McConnell Love in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, on July 15, 1850. Father of Nannie M. Love, John G. Love, Mary B. Love, Ann R. Love, Fannie Love, Buella Love, and Jennie Love. Attended Columbia Academy in Missouri. Served in the 1st Missouri Volunteers from 1846 to 1847. Teacher in Muhlenberg County from 1849 to 1857. Owned three enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Merchant in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel and colonel from 1861 to 1864. Attorney in Greenville, Kentucky, in 1865.
